item.title: Web Server Scanning With Nikto
item.description: Nikto is an open-source web server and web application scanner designed to detect various security vulnerabilities. Developed by Sullo at CIRT, Inc., Nikto scans web servers for over 6700 potentially risky files/programs, checks for outdated server software, and identifies version-specific issues. Originally released in late 2001, it is currently maintained by David Lodge with contributions from other developers. Key Features of Nikto: Detects SQL injection, XSS, and other common vulnerabilities. Identifies installed software via headers, favicons, and files.
